716790f-c.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)
716790f-c.text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from and including East 1st Street, to
Cooper Square. The Empire State Building is shown overshadowing the
Metropolitan Building.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a different perspective of the N.E. corner. Also shown
is East 1st Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of the
Bowery.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 2, slightly more inclusive.
September 20, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710847f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Street - Bowery
710847f-a.text:
(1)
1-9 2nd Street, at, adjoining, and east of the S.E. corner
of the Bowery. Nos. 5-9 are 29 story frame houses.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 549.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
a rear view of the same houses.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 550.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

716793f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)
716793f-a.text:
Bowery, north from but not including East 1st., Street, as seen from
the East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated. Shown in
the backgreund is the Metropolitan, New York Life and the Consolidated
Gas Company Buildings. Cooper Union Iustitute is seen at the bend of
the Elavated structure.
September 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
